clauses.title: Limitation of Liability
clauses.text: Acme Consulting Partners's aggregate liability to Widget Manufacturing Corp under this Agreement, whether arising in contract, tort (including negligence), or otherwise, shall not exceed in any consecutive 12-month period the greater of: (a) 150% of the total fees paid or payable by Widget Manufacturing Corp to Acme Consulting Partners during such 12-month period; or (b) £5,000,000.

clauses.title: Unlimited Liability Carve-Outs
clauses.text: Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or exclude either Party's liability for: (a) death or personal injury caused by its negligence; (b) fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; (c) willful misconduct only.

clauses.title: Service Credits
clauses.text: For each 1.0% shortfall below target availability, Widget Manufacturing Corp shall receive service credits equal to 1% of monthly fees for the affected Services. Total service credits in any calendar month shall not exceed 20% of monthly fees.

clauses.title: Data Breach Notification
clauses.text: Acme Consulting Partners must promptly notify Widget Manufacturing Corp within 12 hours of discovery of any actual or suspected security incident or Personal Data breach. Acme Consulting Partners must cooperate in all investigations and notify Data Subjects and regulators as required by law.

clauses.title: Audit Rights
clauses.text: Widget Manufacturing Corp shall have the right to conduct audits of Acme Consulting Partners's performance and compliance up to twice per year upon 30 Business Days' advance notice. Such audit rights shall survive termination for a period of two (2) years.

clauses.title: Termination for Convenience
clauses.text: No Party may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon 30 days' prior written notice to the other Party.

clauses.title: Intellectual Property Ownership
clauses.text: All Deliverables, work product, and Intellectual Property created by Acme Consulting Partners under this Agreement shall be owned by Acme Consulting Partners. Acme Consulting Partners hereby assigns all rights, title, and interest in such IP to Acme Consulting Partners.

clauses.title: Confidentiality Obligations
clauses.text: Each Party shall maintain the confidentiality of the other Party's Confidential Information and use it solely for purposes of this Agreement. These obligations shall survive termination for a period of 2 years.

clauses.title: Payment Terms
clauses.text: Widget Manufacturing Corp shall pay all undisputed invoices within 15 days of receipt. Late payments shall accrue interest at 1.5% per annum.

clauses.title: Insurance Requirements
clauses.text: Acme Consulting Partners shall maintain the following insurance coverage throughout the term: (a) Professional Indemnity Insurance of at least £2,000,000; (b) Cyber Liability Insurance of at least £1,000,000; (c) General Liability Insurance of at least £2,000,000.

recommendations.reasoning: The Unlimited Liability Carve-Outs lacks reciprocal obligations, creating a one-sided risk allocation that could result in significant unbudgeted costs.
recommendations.recommended_action: Introduce a cap on unlimited liability at 100% of annual fees or £2M to limit maximum exposure.

recommendations.reasoning: The Service Credits lacks reciprocal obligations, creating a one-sided risk allocation that could result in significant unbudgeted costs.
recommendations.recommended_action: Propose reducing liability cap to 100% of annual fees or £2M to align with industry standards and contract value.

recommendations.reasoning: The clause imposes notification requirements on the Service Provider without any corresponding obligation on the Customer, creating an unbalanced commercial relationship.
recommendations.recommended_action: Introduce mutual audit rights for both Parties to ensure fairness.

recommendations.reasoning: The allocation of liability exposure is heavily weighted against the Service Provider, with insufficient protections or caps in place.
recommendations.recommended_action: Propose reducing liability cap to 100% of annual fees or £2M to align with industry standards and contract value.
